<a id="class_Bone2D"></a>

# Bone2D

**Inherits:** [Node2D](class_node2d.md) **<** [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md) **<** [Node](class_node.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

A joint used with [Skeleton2D](class_skeleton2d.md) to control and animate other nodes.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A hierarchy of **Bone2D**\ s can be bound to a [Skeleton2D](class_skeleton2d.md) to control and animate other [Node2D](class_node2d.md) nodes.

You can use **Bone2D** and [Skeleton2D](class_skeleton2d.md) nodes to animate 2D meshes created with the [Polygon2D](class_polygon2d.md) UV editor.

Each bone has a [rest](class_bone2d.md#class_Bone2D_property_rest) transform that you can reset to with [apply_rest()](class_bone2d.md#class_Bone2D_method_apply_rest). These rest poses are relative to the bone's parent.

If in the editor, you can set the rest pose of an entire skeleton using a menu option, from the code, you need to iterate over the bones to set their individual rest poses.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="class_Bone2D_property_rest"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Transform2D](class_transform2d.md) **rest** = `Transform2D(0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_property_rest)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rest**\ (\ value\: [Transform2D](class_transform2d.md)\ )
- [Transform2D](class_transform2d.md) **get_rest**\ (\ )

Rest transform of the bone. You can reset the node's transforms to this value using [apply_rest()](class_bone2d.md#class_Bone2D_method_apply_rest).

<hr class="classref-section-separator">

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_apply_rest"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_rest**\ (\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_apply_rest)

Resets the bone to the rest pose. This is equivalent to setting [Node2D.transform](class_node2d.md#class_Node2D_property_transform) to [rest](class_bone2d.md#class_Bone2D_property_rest).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_get_autocalculate_length_and_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **get_autocalculate_length_and_angle**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_get_autocalculate_length_and_angle)

Returns whether this **Bone2D** is going to autocalculate its length and bone angle using its first **Bone2D** child node, if one exists. If there are no **Bone2D** children, then it cannot autocalculate these values and will print a warning.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_get_bone_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](class_float.md) **get_bone_angle**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_get_bone_angle)

Returns the angle of the bone in the **Bone2D**.

\ **Note:** This is different from the **Bone2D**'s rotation. The bone's angle is the rotation of the bone shown by the gizmo, which is unaffected by the **Bone2D**'s [Node2D.transform](class_node2d.md#class_Node2D_property_transform).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_get_index_in_skeleton"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **get_index_in_skeleton**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_get_index_in_skeleton)

Returns the node's index as part of the entire skeleton. See [Skeleton2D](class_skeleton2d.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_get_length"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](class_float.md) **get_length**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_get_length)

Returns the length of the bone in the **Bone2D** node.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_get_skeleton_rest"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Transform2D](class_transform2d.md) **get_skeleton_rest**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_get_skeleton_rest)

Returns the node's [rest](class_bone2d.md#class_Bone2D_property_rest) [Transform2D](class_transform2d.md) if it doesn't have a parent, or its rest pose relative to its parent.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_set_autocalculate_length_and_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_autocalculate_length_and_angle**\ (\ auto_calculate\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_set_autocalculate_length_and_angle)

When set to ``true``, the **Bone2D** node will attempt to automatically calculate the bone angle and length using the first child **Bone2D** node, if one exists. If none exist, the **Bone2D** cannot automatically calculate these values and will print a warning.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_set_bone_angle"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_bone_angle**\ (\ angle\: [float](class_float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_set_bone_angle)

Sets the bone angle for the **Bone2D**. This is typically set to the rotation from the **Bone2D** to a child **Bone2D** node.

\ **Note:** This is different from the **Bone2D**'s rotation. The bone's angle is the rotation of the bone shown by the gizmo, which is unaffected by the **Bone2D**'s [Node2D.transform](class_node2d.md#class_Node2D_property_transform).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Bone2D_method_set_length"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **set_length**\ (\ length\: [float](class_float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#class_Bone2D_method_set_length)

Sets the length of the bone in the **Bone2D**.
